data.title: Baraka (1992)
data.shortSummary: A wordless documentary photographing life across the world

data.title: Farha (2021)
data.shortSummary: A brutal coming-of-age film set at the start of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict

data.title: Listen (2020)
data.shortSummary: A heartbreaking portrayal of a struggling immigrant family of a child with disability

data.title: The Great Buster: A Celebration (2018)
data.shortSummary: An excellent introduction to the screen legend, as smooth as Old Stone Face himself

data.title: Orlando (1992)
data.shortSummary: A queer magic realist period drama based on the feminist classic

data.title: Tropical Malady (2004)
data.shortSummary: Enter a world where love and nature are one

data.title: Martin Eden (2019)
data.shortSummary: A vivid and nostalgic adaptation of the 1909 novel, now set in Naples

data.title: Taipei Story (1985)
data.shortSummary: A slow-paced tale of former childhood sweethearts stuck in 1980s Taiwan

data.title: Irma Vep (1996)
data.shortSummary: A satiric take on French filmmaking through the eyes of Maggie Cheung

data.title: Buñuel in the Labyrinth of the Turtles (2018)
data.shortSummary: A stunning and surreal portrait of an iconic Spanish filmmaker

data.title: No Bears (2022)
data.shortSummary: An urgent meta thriller filmed in secret by one of our most important filmmakers today

data.title: Holy Spider (2022)
data.shortSummary: A timely and terrifying noir that takes on systemic abuse and corruption in Iran

data.title: Gloomy Sunday (1999)
data.shortSummary: A mysterious World War II romance with a fascinating dynamic between its three lovers

data.title: Cave of Forgotten Dreams (2011)
data.shortSummary: An exploration of the Chauvet Cave turned into a meditation of the human soul

data.title: Decision to Leave (2022)
data.shortSummary: A strange but endlessly compelling love story-slash-mystery from South Korean master Park Chan-wook

data.title: Tár (2022)
data.shortSummary: A haunting and cerebral character study with an undeniable performance by Cate Blanchett

data.title: Anomalisa (2016)
data.shortSummary: A chilling adult animated film that fully immerses you into mid-life depression and mental illness

data.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande (2022)
data.shortSummary: An excellent two-hander about sex work and aging

data.title: Descendant (2022)
data.shortSummary: A remarkably intelligent account of how lost history shapes one's culture, environment, and outlook on justice

data.title: Fire of Love (2022)
data.shortSummary: A gorgeous deep dive into the explosive love story between two scientists and their craft

data.title: The Banshees of Inisherin (2022)
data.shortSummary: A chilling Irish tragicomedy from the director of In Bruges

data.title: Riders of Justice (2021)
data.shortSummary: Nothing is random in this riotous Danish action-black comedy about coincidences and found families

data.title: Hit the Road (2021)
data.shortSummary: A uniquely mysterious spin on the family vacation movie, with a sobering real-world twist

data.title: Some Kind of Heaven (2020)
data.shortSummary: An intriguing documentary that dives deep into a suspiciously euphoric retirement community

data.title: System Crasher (2019)
data.shortSummary: A tale of trauma and one of the most talked about movies on Netflix in 2020.

data.title: All That Breathes (2022)
data.shortSummary: A unique, lyrical documentary that looks at New Delhi from the perspective of a wildlife rescue center

data.title: Pieces of a Woman (2020)
data.shortSummary: An unnerving but honest look at childbirth, partnership, and grief

data.title: The Man Who Sold His Skin (2020)
data.shortSummary: A Syrian man becomes artwork in this fascinating drama based on a true story

data.title: Hail Satan? (2019)
data.shortSummary: Forget everything you think you know about the Satanic Temple

data.title: Sound of Metal (2020)
data.shortSummary: Riz Ahmed excels in this piercing drama about a musician losing his hearing.

data.title: The Nightingale (2018)
data.shortSummary: An unsettling but important social horror from the director of The Babadook

data.title: Control Room (2004)
data.shortSummary: By closely following the media coverage of the Iraq war on both sides, Control Room serves as the ultimate proof that objectivity is a myth

data.title: The Red Turtle (2017)
data.shortSummary: An astonishing, dialogue-free animated fable featuring nature as its only protagonist

data.title: The Breadwinner (2017)
data.shortSummary: A moving and eye-opening drama about a young girl’s bravery in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan

data.title: West Beirut (1998)
data.shortSummary: A young boy is shocked to learn about the civil war that breaks out in his country

data.title: All The Beauty And The Bloodshed (2022)
data.shortSummary: A stunning portrait of the artist as activist

data.title: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio (2022)
data.shortSummary: A more realistic adaptation that still stays true to the story's heart

data.title: I Lost My Body (2019)
data.shortSummary: The Oscar-nominated unconventional animation

data.title: Till (2022)
data.shortSummary: The latest entry in a long line of social issue dramas, Till stands out for its nuanced blend of intimacy and universality

data.title: A Touch of Sin (2013)
data.shortSummary: An exploration of violence in capitalist China

data.title: In the Same Breath (2021)
data.shortSummary: A Chinese filmmaker's account of COVID-19 cover-ups and propaganda

data.title: Days of Being Wild (1990)
data.shortSummary: A dreamy rumination on the beauty of unattainable romance

data.title: Grave of the Fireflies (1988)
data.shortSummary: A heartwrenching look at war and the toll it takes on one's humanity

data.title: Quo Vadis Aida? (2020)
data.shortSummary: A difficult and alarmingly timely portrayal of the Srebrenica massacre

data.title: On the Count of Three (2021)
data.shortSummary: A darkly comic tale following two best friends on the last day of their lives

data.title: Bad Axe (2022)
data.shortSummary: A precious snapshot of a fraught time in American history

data.title: One Night in Miami (2020)
data.shortSummary: A nuanced look at Malcolm X and Muhammad Ali

data.title: Shiva Baby (2021)
data.shortSummary: Sharp and anxious, modern and socially claustrophobic, Shiva Baby is a gem

data.title: Nothing Compares (2022)
data.shortSummary: A long overdue reassessment of an artist ahead of her time

data.title: The Black Power Mixtape 1967-1975 (2011)
data.shortSummary: A fascinating 'mixtape' of never-before-seen footage of the Black Power movement

data.title: Crystal Swan (2018)
data.shortSummary: A young DJ is caught between tradition and modernity in '90s Belarus

data.title: The Edge of Democracy (2019)
data.shortSummary: Mixing personal history with hardcore journalism, this is the story of Brazil's fragile democracy.

data.title: Sink or Swim (1990)
data.shortSummary: Su Friedrich’s experimental documentary combines memory and storytelling to recollect her strained relationship with her father and her fragmented sense of self

data.title: Wind River (2017)
data.shortSummary: Sicario's screenwriter directs this story of murder in an Indigenous reserve

data.title: The Wolf House (2018)
data.shortSummary: A bone-chilling fairy-tale, as mortifying as it is breathtaking

data.title: Safe (1995)
data.shortSummary: In this disturbing psychological drama, a wealthy woman’s suburban life is turned upside down when she suddenly becomes sick with “environmental illness"

data.title: Saint Omer (2022)
data.shortSummary: The complexities of humanity are tackled in this profound, poetic, and immensely powerful French film

data.title: By the Grace of God (2018)
data.shortSummary: A damning account of a cover-up by the Catholic church in France

data.title: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy (2021)
data.shortSummary: Three separate stories intertwined with themes of love and fate

data.title: A Hero (2021)
data.shortSummary: Another complex Iranian drama from the director of A Separation

data.title: This Is Not a Film (2011)
data.shortSummary: An ode to the persistence of artistic freedom amidst repression

data.title: Fifi Howls from Happiness (2014)
data.shortSummary: The unknown story of "Iran's Picasso" rescued moments away from his death

data.title: Vera Drake (2004)
data.shortSummary: Women’s rights and class collide in Mike Leigh’s immaculate period piece

data.title: Scheme Birds (2019)
data.shortSummary: A narrative documentary about a young Scottish woman entering adulthood and motherhood against a backdrop of violence

data.title: I’m Thinking of Ending Things (2020)
data.shortSummary: A reference-heavy mind-bender from Charlie Kaufman

data.title: Retablo (2017)
data.shortSummary: A quiet but potent coming-of-age drama

data.title: A Dry White Season (1989)
data.shortSummary: A grizzly portrait of the cruel brutality of apartheid in 70s South Africa

data.title: Dark Waters (2019)
data.shortSummary: Mark Ruffalo excels in an outrageous but important story

data.title: Zappa (2020)
data.shortSummary: The un-summarizable rich life of a cultural legend

data.title: Sami Blood
data.shortSummary: A spectacularily acted story about dealing with racism as an indigenous teenager

data.title: Doubt (2008)
data.shortSummary: Catholicism, suspicion and the nature of doubt

data.title: The Crying Game (1992)
data.shortSummary: Neil Jordan's masterpiece psychological thriller

data.title: Angry Inuk (2016)
data.shortSummary: How animal rights groups harm Inuit communities

data.title: Syndromes and a Century (2006)
data.shortSummary: A gentle meditation on human experience set in two hospitals

data.title: The Body Remembers When The World Broke Open (2019)
data.shortSummary: Brilliantly and painfully realistic

data.title: Skin (2018)
data.shortSummary: Jamie Bell as a White Supremacist

data.title: Jim & Andy: The Great Beyond – Featuring a Very Special, Contractually Obligated Mention of Tony Clifton (2017)
data.shortSummary: Watch Jim Carrey take method acting to the extreme as he transforms into his idol Andy Kaufmann.

data.title: We the Animals (2018)
data.shortSummary: A stunning coming-of-age drama

data.title: The End of the Tour (2015)
data.shortSummary: An unconventional and thought-provoking road movie featuring Jason Segel as the legendary writer David Foster Wallace

data.title: Captain Fantastic (2016)
data.shortSummary: Viggo Mortensen is fantastic in this plot-twisting drama about a survivalist American family

data.title: Atlantics (2019)
data.shortSummary: A poetic drama from Senegal

data.title: Mommy (2014)
data.shortSummary: Aiming straight for the heart while punching you in the guts, Mommy is a crazy chamber piece about a widowed mother and her next-door neighbor bringing up a savage teenager

data.title: Streetwise (1984)
data.shortSummary: A clear-eyed and tender documentary of youth living in the streets of eighties Seattle

data.title: Never Rarely Sometimes Always (2020)
data.shortSummary: A painfully realistic journey of unplanned teenage pregnancy

data.title: On Body and Soul (2017)
data.shortSummary: A unique love story that exists only in two people's dreams.

data.title: Best of Enemies (2015)
data.shortSummary: An engrossing and entertaining look at an iconic series of American political debates in the late 1960s.

data.title: Elle (2016)
data.shortSummary: An always-excellent Isabelle Huppert powers this thrilling French revenge film

data.title: Weiner (2016)
data.shortSummary: A riveting portrait of a fallen man’s attempts at gaining forgiveness and political re-entry

data.title: McQueen (2018)
data.shortSummary: An intimate look at the genius of iconic fashion designer Alexander McQueen

data.title: Mass (2021)
data.shortSummary: A microscopic and unrelenting look at grief and healing

data.title: The Report (2019)
data.shortSummary: If you liked Adam McKay's Vice, you will love this

data.title: Cure (1997)
data.shortSummary: A series of mysterious murders leads a detective to a former psychological student

data.title: A Cop Movie (2021)
data.shortSummary: An empathetic and impressively inventive look at the notoriously corrupt Mexican police force

data.title: Land and Freedom (1995)
data.shortSummary: A sober and dignified account of Marxist fighters in the Spanish Civil War

data.title: Beau travail (1999)
data.shortSummary: Claire Denis’ portrait of masculine angst and decaying military tradition is an operatic juggernaut

data.title: School Life (2016)
data.shortSummary: A compassionate year-in-the-life documentary about two seasoned teachers nearing retirement at an Irish boarding school

data.title: Cousins
data.shortSummary: A moving tribute to the lives of three Māori women in colonial New Zealand

data.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco (2019)
data.shortSummary: On the yearning for a home

data.title: Girl (2019)
data.shortSummary: A humane illustration of the trans teenage experience

data.title: Manchester by the Sea (2016)
data.shortSummary: Kenneth Lonergan's third film is honest, strange, and affecting drama.

data.title: Fruitvale Station (2013)
data.shortSummary: Compassionate filmmaking reconstructing a 24-hour police brutality story – with a stunning lead by Michael B. Jordan

data.title: Hive (2021)
data.shortSummary: A moving portrait of grief and resilience

data.title: Sunday Beauty Queen (2016)
data.shortSummary: Expats find home in this beautifully balanced documentary on overseas work

data.title: Born in Evin (2020)
data.shortSummary: Born in Iran's worst prison, a filmmaker's quest for truth

data.title: Meeting Gorbachev (2019)
data.shortSummary: Werner Herzog says "I love you" to Gorbachev

data.title: After Innocence (2005)
data.shortSummary: Portraits of life after wrongful conviction

data.title: Gather (2020)
data.shortSummary: An inspiring and hopeful look at the indigenous food sovereignty movement

data.title: The Salesman (2016)
data.shortSummary: Another fascinating look at family dynamics in Iran from the director of A Separation
The inventive sequel to In the Mood for Love

data.title: Zero Days (2016)
data.shortSummary: A rich and informative documentary that serves as a wake-up call to the threat of cyber warfare.

data.title: Paddleton (2019)
data.shortSummary: A Genuine and Beautifully-Acted Drama

data.title: The Look of Silence (2015)
data.shortSummary: A devastating documentary on reconciliation in the shadow of the Indonesian Genocide.

data.title: Buddies (1985)
data.shortSummary: The first film to deal with the AIDS crisis, by those it affected

data.title: I Am Not Your Negro (2017)
data.shortSummary: A vivid portrayal of an incendiary intellectual – and an angry appeal for civil rights

data.title: The Father (2020)
data.shortSummary: Dementia, thoughtfully examined and artfully portrayed

data.title: The Hunt (2013)
data.shortSummary: A nightmarish drama dealing with complex questions, fully carried by Mads Mikkelsen’s unforgettable performance

data.title: Warehoused (2015)
data.shortSummary: A quiet allegory from Mexico

data.title: Ex Machina (2015)
data.shortSummary: Shiny visuals meet complex ideas in this brilliant sci-fi thriller.

data.title: Apostasy (2017)
data.shortSummary: A drama on the impact of religion on family bonds

data.title: Icarus (2017)
data.shortSummary: An Academy-Award-winning documentary that set out to explore performance-enhancing drugs before stirring up a hornet's nest

data.title: Mr. Nobody (2009)
data.shortSummary: This ambitious sci-fi romance with Jared Leto has become an indie cult classic.

data.title: Blackfish (2013)
data.shortSummary: A revelatory documentary on the treatment of Orcas that is gripping like a thriller.

data.title: Blue Is the Warmest Color (2013)
data.shortSummary: Raw and absorbing drama with two unbelievably gripping lead performances

data.title: Virunga (2014)
data.shortSummary: Award-winning documentary on three brave individuals fighting deadly forces in contemporary Congo.

data.title: Never Look Away (2018)
data.shortSummary: The follow-up to The Lives of Others

headline: Popular + Thought-provoking
subtitle: Find the best thought-provoking movies to watch, from our mood category. Like everything on agoodmovietowatch, these thought-provoking movies are highly-rated by both viewers and critics.
